From: Anju Pathak, Tek Inspirations LLC anju.pathak@tekinspirations.com Reply to: anju.pathak@tekinspirations.com Job Description -LinkedIn mandatory, EST candidates preferred
Salesforce Business Analyst
Remote
Visa that does not expire in the next year is good, No H1B/CPT Candidates MUST have experience working with Salesforce’s dedicated data model: Public Sector Solutions (PSS). Applicants without this experience will not be considered.
REQUIRED/DESIRED SKILLSSkill Required/Desired Years of Experience
Experience as a Salesforce BA working with a software development project team (Required 5)
Experience with Salesforce’s dedicated data model: Public Sector Solutions (Required 2)
Experience with customer relationship management platforms including Salesforce. (Required 5)
Experience applying Agile Scrum to projects with multiple Scrum teams utilizing a Scrum of Scrums approach. (Required 5)
Previous experience in Project Management or using Agile methodology (Required 3)
Experience with user story construction, user story estimation, sprint health indicators (burn-down/burn-up), velocity, continuous improvement (Required 3)
Experience coaching and influencing multi-disciplined and cross-functional teams (Required 4)
Modern software engineering techniques - Continuous integration, build, deliver, test-driven development & other automated acceptance testing techniques (Required 3)
Scrum Master certification required (Required 3)
Exceptional written and oral communication skills are required as candidate will work with various teams and stakeholders in role (Required)
Work with Product Support Specialists, Technical Leads, Development Team and Stakeholders to deliver low code, no code, out of the box solutions.
Participates in planning sessions with Business Partners, Developers, and Stakeholders to identify dependencies, craft delivery strategies, and involve customers in early, incremental delivery of Saleforce’s dedicated data model; Public Sector Solutions.
Heavily involvement in planning stages: identify goals and vision, remove impediments and block distractions in order to keep the agile team focused on committed objectives.
A deep agile toolbox including awareness of various agile techniques, alternate project management approaches and the wisdom to understand when to apply which process to the problem at hand.
Facilitates scrum and agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
Proficient with Agile methods such as story sizing, backlog management, story mapping, etc.
Demonstrated experience managing multiple time-sensitive, complex projects, involving multiple stakeholders and/or external vendors.
Responsible for supporting complex projects/products and programs using pre-existing knowledge, skills, templates, and expertise in various organizational and implementation methodologies.
Responsible for concurrently managing multiple projects/products with multiple teams across multiple business areas in a matrixed reporting structure.
Assists with removing roadblocks and manages the process and culture to ensure team progress and continuous improvement.
Assists Product Owners enact effective backlog grooming techniques; facilitate sprint planning, daily scrum, and sprint retrospectives.
Proactively address issues, conflicts, and bottlenecks, ensuring a smooth and efficient workflow
Drive continuous improvement within the team by identifying opportunities for process enhancement and efficiency.
Provide training, mentorship, and support to team members on Agile principles and Scrum practices.
